alert.note: Alert for Northern El Paso County, Monument Ridge, Rampart Range Below 7500 Ft; Pikes Peak above 11000 Ft (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued August 15 at 2:26PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: .Monsoonal moisture interacting with passing cold frontal boundary will produce numerous showers and thunderstorms, capable of heavy rainfall. ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT MDT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...El Paso and Teller Counties. * WHEN...Until Midnight MDT tonight. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Monsoonal moisture interacting with passing cold frontal boundary will produce numerous showers and thunderstorms, capable of heavy rainfall. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.

area.areaDesc: Northern El Paso County, Monument Ridge, Rampart Range Below 7500 Ft; Pikes Peak above 11000 Ft
